ACT
11
The testator's parents and spouse
The testator who left no descendants is inherited by his parents and his spouse.
The testator's parents inherit one half of the estate in equal parts, and the other half of the estate is inherited by the testator's spouse.
If both parents died before the testator, the spouse inherits the entire estate.
If the testator is not survived by a spouse, the testator's parents inherit the entire estate in equal parts.
If one of the testator's parents died before the testator, the part of the estate that would have belonged to him if he had survived the testator is inherited by the other parent.
